SENT.plain: A 20-year-old man with rapid refractory pulmonary infiltrates, fever, and chill was admitted to our hospital
Microscopic examination showed focal necrosis of the lung tissue, arterial thromboembolism, and alveolar hemorrhage
He tested positive for anticardiolipin IgG antibodies
Because of the absence of underlying diseases, the possibility of secondary antiphospholipid antibody syndrome was excluded
Follow-up chest CT after 2 years revealed pulmonary arterial aneurysms with diffuse ground-glass opacities
The aneurysms were occluded by coil embolization
